intro: Haplopappus venetus, commonly known as the slender pappus plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular flowers surrounded by bracts. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are usually arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and the leaves are narrow and linear. Haplopappus venetus is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
